Package utility

Class inputcheck

java.lang.Object
utility.inputcheck
public class inputcheck extends Object
This is a utility class that provides methods to check user input on certain text fields.
Author:
Arun Rai

  • Method Details

    • checkString

      public static String checkString(javafx.scene.control.TextField text, String outputtext, javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      After a user clicks save on the Customer or Appointment pages it sends certain TextFields that are supposed to contain strings to this method. Checks if a string input from a TextField is valid based on several criteria, such as length and allowed characters. Prints errors to screen using the label parameter indicating invalid data input to the user.
      Parameters:
      text - String to evaluate.
      outputtext - Name of variable that did not pass evaluation so user knows which input did not pass.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      Returns:
      If input is not valid it will return "false_" indicating invalid data, else if the data is valid it will return the string in the TextField.

    • checkPhonenumber

      public static String checkPhonenumber(javafx.scene.control.TextField text, String outputtext, javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      After a user clicks save on the Customer or Appointment pages it sends certain TextFields that are supposed to contain phone numbers to this method. Checks if a string input from a TextField is valid based on several criteria, such as length and allowed characters. Prints errors to screen using the label parameter indicating invalid data input to the user.
      Parameters:
      text - Phone Number to evaluate.
      outputtext - Name of variable that did not pass evaluation so user knows which input did not pass.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      Returns:
      If data is invalid it returns "invalid number_", else if it is valid it will return the phone number user entered in TextField.

    • checkPostalcodeOrAddress

      public static String checkPostalcodeOrAddress(javafx.scene.control.TextField text, String outputtext, javafx.scene.control.Label label, String type)
      After a user clicks save on the Customer or Appointment pages it sends certain TextFields that are supposed to contain Postal code or addresses to this method. Checks if a string input from a TextField is valid based on several criteria, such as length and allowed characters. Prints errors to screen using the label parameter indicating invalid data input to the user.
      Parameters:
      text - Postal Code or Address to evaluate.
      outputtext - Name of variable that did not pass evaluation so user knows which input did not pass.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      type - Character that are allowed in Postal Code or Address.
      Returns:
      f data is invalid it returns "invalid postal code_", else if it is valid it will return the postal code or address user entered in TextField.

    • checkCountryOrDivision

      public static String checkCountryOrDivision(String boxvalue, String outputtext, javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      After user clicks save on the Customer Page, this method will check if the Country/First Division Combo boxes are empty. If it is empty it will print errors to the screen using the label parameter indicating that the combo boxes can not be empty.
      Parameters:
      boxvalue - Country or Division to evaluate.
      outputtext - Name of variable that did not pass evaluation so user knows which input did not pass.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      Returns:
      If Combo Box is empty it will return "not valid country_division", else it will return the value in the ComboBox.

    • checkIfWithinBuisnessHours

      public static String checkIfWithinBuisnessHours(Timestamp startTime, Timestamp endTime, javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      After user clicks save on Appointment Page, The start and end times the user entered for that appointment are passed to this method. They are then evaluated against the Eastern Time business hours. If appointment falls outside the business hours than it print an error to screen using the label parameter.
      Parameters:
      startTime - Start Time of Appointment being evaluated.
      endTime - End Time of Appointment being evaluated.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      Returns:
      If Appointment is within business hours it will return "Within business hours", else it will return "Not within business hours".

    • checkIfStratGreaterThanEnd

      public static String checkIfStratGreaterThanEnd(Timestamp startTime, Timestamp endTime, javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      After user clicks save on Appointment Page, The start and end times the user entered for that appointment are passed to this method. Method will evaluate both times and verify the start time is before the end time. If appointment start time is after end time, that error is printed to screen using the label parameter.
      Parameters:
      startTime - Start Time of Appointment being evaluated.
      endTime - End Time of Appointment being evaluated.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      Returns:
      If Start Time is before End Time returns "good", else returns "not good".

    • checkIfNotWithinAnotherAppointment

      public static String checkIfNotWithinAnotherAppointment(Timestamp startTime, Timestamp endTime, int customerId, javafx.scene.control.Button button, int appointmentId)
      After user clicks save on Appointment Page, The start and end times the user entered for that appointment are passed to this method. These times are then passed to another method in the "allAppointments" class to verify their are no appointments currently within the same time for that customer. If their are appointments within that time, a pop up is loaded indicating the error to user.
      Parameters:
      startTime - Start Time of Appointment being evaluated.
      endTime - End Time of Appointment being evaluated.
      customerId - The Customer, program is checking Appointments for.
      button - Date required to load pop up if their are overlapping Appointments.
      appointmentId - Appointment that is being added or modified.
      Returns:
      If their are appointments within the same time method returns "Overlapping", or else returns "Not overlapping".

    • checkHourAndMinBoxes

      public static String checkHourAndMinBoxes(String starthour, String startmin, String endhour, String endmin, javafx.scene.control.Label startlabel, javafx.scene.control.Label endlabel)
      Checks whether the input fields for start hour, start minute, end hour and end minute are not null. If they one or more are null, errors are printed to screen.
      Parameters:
      starthour - Start Hour
      startmin - Start Minute
      endhour - End Hour
      endmin - End Minute
      startlabel - Label to apply Error Message for "starthour" and "startmin".
      endlabel - Label to apply Error Message for "endhour" and "endmin".
      Returns:
      if no values are null "valid" is returned. If one more values are null than "not valid" is returned.

    • checkNullDate

      public static String checkNullDate(LocalDate date, javafx.scene.control.Label label, String outputtext)
      Checks whether the start or end DatePicker boxes are null or not. If null, errors are printed to screen.
      Parameters:
      date - Date being evaluated.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      outputtext - Error message to print to GUI.
      Returns:
      If DatePicker box is null, "invalid date" is returned, else "valid date" is returned.

    • checkNullCustomerOrUser

      public static String checkNullCustomerOrUser(Integer id, javafx.scene.control.Label label, String outputtext)
      After user clicks save on the Appointment Page, this method will check if the Customer/User Combo boxes are empty. If it is empty it will print errors to the screen using the label parameter indicating that the combo boxes can not be empty.
      Parameters:
      id - Customer or User ID being evaluated.
      label - Label to apply Error Message to on GUI.
      outputtext - Error message to print to GUI.
      Returns:
      If Combo Box is empty it will return "invalid ID", else it will return "valid ID".
